flashcards:
\lim_{x \to a} f(x) = L \iff  \forall \varepsilon>0, \exists \delta>0 : 0<|x-a|<\delta \implies |f(x)-L|<\varepsilon
If for every number \varepsilon>0 there exists a number \delta>0 such that: [condition], then [condition]
Relation between continuous function and a limit
If g is continuous at L and \lim_{x \to a} f(x) = L, then \lim_{x \to a} g(f(x)) = g(\lim_{x \to a} f(x))

topics: Derivative value at a point through limits

flashcards: The general formula for exponential growth and decay
y(t) = y_0 e^{kt}, k>0 growth, k<0 decay
The value of f'(a) using limits
What is L'Hôpital's Rule and when is it used?
\lim_{x \to c} f(x)/g(x) = \lim_{x \to c} f'(x)/g'(x), for f/g = 0/0, ±∞/∞
Rewrite as a fraction: 0*∞ → f(x)/(1/g(x)) or g(x)/(1/f(x))
Take a common denominator or factor
How to solve power indeterminate forms 0^0, ∞^0, 1^∞
Take ln of the functions inside the limit or exponentiate them: lim[f(x)^g(x)] = lim[g(x) ln(f(x))] or lim[f(x)^g(x)] = lim[e^(g(x) ln(f(x)))]

topics: Riemann sum - definition of indefinite integral
Boundary flipping property, Leibniz Integral rule
Substitution Rule: technique, boundaries, symmetrical functions
flashcards: Definite integral definition with limits (Riemann sum)
∫_a^b f(x) dx = lim_{n→∞} Δx Σ_{k=1}^n f(x_k), Δx = (b-a)/n, x_k = a + kΔx
Property for flipping boundaries of Indefinite Integral
1. If g(x)=∫_a^x f(t) dt, then g'(x)=f(x); 2. ∫_a^b f(x) dx = F(b)-F(a), where F'(x) = f(x)
Definite Integrals of Symmetric Functions around 0

topics: Riemann's sum for area between the curves
Volume of a solid through slices
flashcards: Riemann Sum for Area between the Curves
A = lim_{n→∞} Δx Σ_{i=1}^n [f(x_i)-g(x_i)] = ∫_a^b [f(x)-g(x)] dx, Δx=(b-a)/n
Volume of a solid in space
V = ∫_a^b A(x) dx, A(x) = cross-sectional area
A = π(r_out)^2 - π(r_in)^2, r_in = distance to closest function from rotation axis
How to derive the volume of a torus
1. Equation of circle w.r.t y, divide into halves; 2. Right half = outer radius, left = inner, subtract; 3. Integrate from -r to r
1/(b-a) ∫_a^b f(x) dx = lim_{n→∞} Δx Σ f(x_i)/(b-a)

flashcards: 1. If n=2k+1, use u=sin x; 2. If m=2k+1, use u=cos x; 3. If m,n even, use half-angle identities
1. If n even, u=tan x; 2. If m odd, u=sec x; save sec^2 or sec*tan accordingly
Use identity sin A sin B = 1/2[cos(A-B)-cos(A+B)]
Use identity sin A cos B = 1/2[sin(A-B)+sin(A+B)]
Use identity cos A cos B = 1/2[cos(A-B)+cos(A+B)]
Half-angle identities for sin and cos
cos(2θ)=2cos^2 θ -1 = 1-2sin^2 θ → sin θ=±√((1-cos2θ)/2), cos θ=±√((1+cos2θ)/2)
1. deg(P)≥deg(Q) → long division; 2. deg(P)<deg(Q) → partial fractions; 3. D<0, u-sub or complete the square
